this game is mega fun with friends. playing by yourself, aka maining killer can be a bit annoying sometimes but the characters are so fun it's forgettable. i recommend this to horror fans and multiplayer game fans. it's a nice game to play with your friends after a hard day, and an alright one to play alone.

Fun game great to play with friends, can be toxic at times but I find that is on both sides of the game whether you are playing Killer or Survivor or in a SWF. I enjoy playing the game just for the game, mostly in a SWF but am finding I like the challenge of being a Solo Survivor. I do dabble in Killer matches every now and again. To me they are not as enjoyable, but then again I still have a lot to learn about that side of the game. If you like 4v1's then you may enjoy this game. I have met some of the best people from both sides of this game in the DBD community. Don't let the toxic bad apples discourage you. There are those of us out there who are kind and not toxic and would love to play with you.

Nie biorąc pod uwagę społeczności gry, która czasem potrafi zirytować, to gra w mojej opinii jest dość, nawet bardzo ciekawa i ogólnie przyjemna. Parę wad związanych z grą od strony producenta są hitboxy (nie ciągle) ale można zauważyć nie jednokrotnie. Ogólnie podsumowując gra jest na prawdę przyjemna i wg mnie godna polecenia :)

Со временем я понимаю, что, данная игра возможно в будущем будет развиваться, если же разработчики не будут лениться, на носу новое обновление, думаю оно будет стоящее, по сколько за последние 2 года, баланс в игре был полностью убит, ждём дальнейших результатов от разработчиков

Okay, there are quite a few problems in the game when you play as a Killer but first of all I'll tell you about my experience in DBD:
[b] PLAYING AS A SURVIVOR [/b]:
 I played max 30-40 games as a Survivor so I will just tell you that it was fun for me.
[b] PLAYING AS A KILLER [/b]:

[b][i] 0-50 h [/i][/b]
Game is really fun, you start to learn the maps, the killers that you have bought/have for free, you start to understand the basics of the game, no cheaters, no crazy good Survivors, just a balanced game for a newbie.

[b][i] 50-150h [/i][/b]
As you rank up, you can see the different skill level of survivors in your games, none of your games are balanced - you either play vs 4 team premade, 2 tryhards and 2 noobs, 1 tryhard and 3 medicore players, but no cheaters which is good. The problem is the new MMR system, if you take break you will still end up with players you had before your break (in the old system you was playing vs worse players), not like in the CS:GO for example where after a break you play VS a little bit worse players. The MMR system allows you to climb REALLY fast in the hidden MMR stat, you can be in Gold ranks but play vs Red ranks, which is not good IMO. The real problem is the devs plan to get new players, which is to buff surviviors into oblivion and - nerf killers ofc. If you are a Killer main its not a big deal after all cuz you know how to play him, BUT when you try playing a new killer the only way is playing Customs with friends, cuz the MMR was supposed to be different on other killers but it doesnt work as intended. I'm a Ghostface main and when I tried playing someone else like Huntress, Demogorgon, Legion etc I still was playing vs Red rank players like on my main. If you dont learn your killers before ~130 hours you are screwed if you are good on one killer.

[b][i] 150h-223.1h [/i][/b]

The main problem start when you are playing above MMR stat of Red ranks. You don't see any medicore or bad player in Survivors' team, you play vs one of the best players you can find on the server, that have 3000h-5000h+ each. The game is not fun anymore. You MUST tryhard or abuse BROKEN TACTICS to have ANY chance. You can't learn new killer here, forget it. You can't make any mistake to win, you must tryhard. If you make a mistake, expect hard flame and toxicity from survivors cuz they propably haven't seen grass for few weeks. In the EU East servers. Maybe in EU West its different. BUT, what if you start to have fun in this game, win 4/5 games out of 10 and have fun in these ranks? Well then enjoy it until the next patch with new Survivor buffs and Killer nerfs!!! And around the start of 2022 cheaters started ruining high MMR games. They have a cheat to change their MMR, they can fly over the map, give godmode to all survivors, speedhacks etc. 

Summing up, the problems of playing as a Killer are:
[b]-Tryhard survivor lobbies in high MMR
-Non-balanced gameplay in mid to high MMR
-Constant Survivor buffs and Killer nerfs
-Cheaters in high/highest MMR
-Too fast climbing up on the hidden MMR stat[/b]

[i] The game would be good if:
 -they would remake the system to work as they said it would work, and if the MMR was somewhat alligned to your in game time;
 -they would stop buffing survivors and nerfing killers and start to balance the game;
 -change the "anti-cheat" from EAC to something that is a real anti-cheat - [b]EAC allows you to modify game files with 3rd party programs lol[/b] [/i]

[b] If you are a Survivor main, have fun! [/b]

The game is a lot of fun. I enjoy playing killers who are stealthy most. I almost always have fun playing as a survivor.
________________________________
So, I initially reviewed this when I had about 40 hours in the game. I'm at nearly 700, which I admit, is a lot for some games, and less for others.
I still love it.

I play survivor in solo queue, or with friends on discord.
I play killer, sometimes with meme builds, sometimes without perks, and sometimes with no perks - if you want to learn the strength of a killer, play a few games with no perks before you add some on. You will lose, but you'll learn a lot. It's how I became a decent Nurse player.

There are flaws to this game, sure.
The company that makes it... eh. Sometimes they listen to the community, sometimes they do not, and sometimes the community is, IMO, wrong.

Either way, I still love the game, and I still play it at least a few rounds every few days.

But it is 10 times better if you have friends to play with or enjoy the challenge of being a killer.

tus compañeros estan siendo perseguidos, vos estas haciendo gens; tus compañeros fueron colgados, vos haces gens; cuando el killer te persigue a vos? llevaselo a tu amigo haciendo un gen, easy. Muy buen juego para jugar con tus amigos, aunque la mayoria de los killers son tryhard y la vas a parir algunas partidas son graciosas y pasas un buen momento. La sube mucho poder jugar como steve harrignton vestido de scoops ahoy. Ganar peeps es facil, solo hace gens y ayuda a tus compañeros y listo, ya sos rango 4. Para llegar a rango 4 juga con un amigo, y si podes que se llame guido, eso va a darte mas chances mientras él baja de rango haciendo lo mismo que haces vos. Pero sacando algunos bugs, hitboxes, el juego esta muy bueno, lo recomiendo. 
BOBman out.

Dead by daylight é um jogo de pura adrelina, seja você sendo o assassino ou sobrevivente. É um jogo que no início é difícil e te faz buscar referências externas como vídeos, amigos, entre outros para progredir. DBD traz consigo uma variedade ampla de assassinos e sobreviventes fazendo com que você não se canse de jogar com apenas um único personagem. Eu super indico DBD pra aqueles que gostam de adrelina pura chegando até ficar sem fôlego em certos momentos. A trilha sonora é aterrorizante, sons de batimentos cardíacos te deixam fixados a cada movimento do assassino, sons de personagens clássicos como Freddy Krueger e Michael Myers te deixam com mais medo ainda por você ja conhecer os personagens. Enfim, super indicado DBD pra quem gosta desse tipo de game.

Очень бесят лаганые хит боксы. Когда в тебя охотница кидает топор, и он попадает в воздух, то тебя всё равно драбалызнет, это очень бесит. Ещё хотелось бы чтобы пробитие полет и окон было более нормальным (та же ситуация что и с топорами). А так, советую.

This is that game where you say "I fucking hate this game" after every single match, but then you put 500 more hours into it

On a more serious note, this is my favorite game of all time. The community is negative and toxic as shit, but at the end of the day there is something magnificent about this game that keeps you coming back for more. The options are endless, the graphics are getting better and better, the lore is fun, the cosmetics are insane, and every game has a different feel to it. I've met countless friends through DBD, one of which is the love of my life who I've been with for 4 years now. For all its ups and downs, there's a lot of soul here, and I'd highly recommend giving it the time it deserves. Just beware... There is a big learning curve. All the best and rock on BHVR xoxo
